meanings.definition: One who prevails or is victorious.
meanings.sent1: The prevailer in the race crossed the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: The team captain was the prevailer in the championship game.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel was the prevailer in the nut-gathering contest.
meanings.sent4: The prevailer of the spelling bee was crowned the champion.
meanings.sent5: The prevailer of the talent show received a standing ovation.

meanings.definition: To prove more powerful or superior; triumph.
meanings.sent1: Despite the challenges, she managed to prevailer in the end.
meanings.sent2: The hero will prevailer over the villain in the final battle.
meanings.sent3: The cake prevailer over the cookies at the bake-off.
meanings.sent4: Love will always prevailer over hate in the end.
meanings.sent5: The sun will prevailer over the clouds, bringing a bright day.
